comments:
I have installed the Calisto build on Linux.

I setup the integrated agent to be enabled and Always running

Profiling hangs until I shutdown eclipse and kill the profile processes. When I restart eclipse I get the error message.

While loading class "org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.proxy.ProcessProxy", thread "Agent Controller Process Polling" timed out waiting (5000ms) for thread "main" to finish starting bundle "org.eclipse.hyades.execution". To avoid deadlock, thread "Agent Controller Process Polling" is proceeding but "org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.internal.proxy.ProcessProxy" may not be fully initialized.

stack trace.

eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.4.2_11
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_AU
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86


I am running redhat enterprise 4 but have the same problem running on centos 3.2
Reassigning to Bob for triage and determination of target for fixing.

Hi
I was able to reproduce this error on redhat enterprise 4 using IBM JDK 1.4.2, as well as on Debian using Sun 1.5.0

This is a known problem that has been documented in the release notes for 4.1.0
http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/releasenotes/releasenotes4_1_0.html#1_2_4
Please refer to cause #2.

I believe there is another bug opened for this issue however; I am not sure which one it is.

The work around as mentioned in the release notes is to remove the ramaster file and anything else in the /tmp/IBMRAC folder.

Thanks Thayaparan Shanmugaratnam,  with a little messing about I now have profiling working (why does it now have problems with the DISPLAY variable ?)

The answer is a bit buried in the release notes and was not the case with previous
TPTP.
Housekeeping: set target to 4.2.1 (which is the timeframe of this exchange/resolution although no fix was made/needed for this).
